content.description: This short route is located around the corner from El Diablo and can be climbed to reach the anchors of that climb. The easiest route is to start in a crumbly corner and then traverse left to the crack. A little bit harder but more fun is the direct start which pulls straight up on the undermined base of the cliff at around 5.8.
content.protection:
A single bolt is located 20ft off the ground, at the point where one traverses left. Trad gear can be used for the rest of the route. If you climb the direct start, the bolt is your first piece of protection. 

  There is no fixed anchor for this climb, but one can be set up with a few wires or cams or by tying off on a large boulder at the summit. At least 10 feet of webbing will be needed to utilize the boulder. The  bolt anchors for El Diablo are 5 ft beyond and below the boulder.

content.description: Just to the left of El Diablo is another beautiful line. The crux is right at the start and a conveniently located boulder makes for great photo ops. Sustained climbing all the way up, this climb is well worth the visit.
content.protection: One advantage that this climb has over its neighbor is the ease at which the top-rope bolt anchors are reached. Simply walk around to the back-side of the formation and peer through a break in the rock wall and you will be looking down from the top of the climb. The bolt anchors are within arms reach when you sit on top of a 7ft high rock shoulder.

content.description: The right facing corner starts very shallow but deepens gradually. The seam at the start becomes a crack, which continues to widen. The rock quality decreasing upward while the holds become larger and more numerous. The crux is at the bottom 10 feet of the route. Harder variations to either side are possible at several heights.
content.protection: It can be led, but first placement is rather high and the rest of the route a bit dirty, so top roping is recommended. This is easy to do with trad gear and possibly by tying boulders.
content.location: The most prominent crack on the wall left of Speak in English distinguished by going straight to the top with only one minor step-over to the left high up on the wall. The route is located center of the most textured part of the darker area.

content.description: The pure aesthetics of this route are what make it interesting. The holds are thin or sloped and test your balance, and imagination, more than your strength.
content.protection: The bolt anchors are reached by climbing The Waffer or by high bouldering up the backside of the formation.

content.description: Near the center of The Garden area is an eye-catching formation of reddish stone and perfectly smooth faces. The geometry alone of this formation makes it noteworthy. There are three routes on this formation, El Diablo is the clean line directly up the middle.
